intro: Calycogonium torbecianum, commonly known as the Torbecian's calycogonium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring tendrils and lobed leaves typical of the cucumber family. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. It is primarily found in specific habitats in southern Europe, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
